text.p: -- Local investment bank Banco Omega said it was downgrading its recommendation on Brazilian pulp and paper giant Aracruz Celulose S.A. to hold minus from hold.
-- Omega analyst Renato Tranjan said next year's improving earnings outlook for the company already has been fully factored into share prices and a lack of news on the firm make it less attractive.
-- "At this point, we would only recommend the stock as a long-term prospect," he told Reuters.

-- The company so far this year has done poorly compared with last year, with its holding firm posting a $20.3 million net loss in the third quarter compared with $91.5 million profit in the same period last year.
-- "There was a sharp drop in sales," Tranjan said.
-- Omega forecasts Aracruz's holding will close the year with a net loss of $5.9 million and post a $77 million net profit in 1997, he added.
-- Aracruz's ADR was up 1/8 at 7 7/8 at 1322 local/1022 EST on the New York Stock Exchange. Its voting common was untraded at its Oct 24 closing of 1.80 reais on the Sao Paulo bourse.
